Contradict fact: The claim that the Central Park Five "admitted their guilt" contradicts the evidence and facts presented, as the young men later recanted their confessions.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the level of guilt of the Central Park Five by stating that they admitted their guilt, when in fact they later recanted their confessions.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that the Central Park Five admitted their guilt.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Central Park Five admitted their guilt based on the statements made by President Trump, without considering the evidence and facts that suggest otherwise.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the Central Park Five made false confessions under pressure or coercion from the police.
